intro: Capsella austriaca, commonly known as the common mouse-ear or mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant typically grows to a height of about 20–60 centimeters and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers with four petals. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the fruit is a dry, segmented pod that splits open to release seeds. Capsella austriaca is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows.
